results.title: Towards 2000: Robots and Energy
results.brief_description: The Robots are Coming- More and more jobs are being taken over each year by the robots of the world. Most of the jobs are tedious, but the robots don’t seem to mind. “Energy”- The sun and the wind could supply us with most of our energy needs - pollution free. “Research Into Space”- The Americans and the Russians are showing the world that space has no boundaries but getting up there does present problems from time to time. “Other Changes”- Electronic bagpipes and a hotel room the size of a phone box - they are just two of the changes taking place right now.

results.title: The Living planet. - Part 1: the building of the earth
results.brief_description: Part One of a two part series. From the sub zero temperatures of the polar ice-caps to the baking heat of the deserts, from the ash-strewn sides of a volcano to the dense vegetation of a tropical forest, the environments on Earth are no less remarkable than the variety of life itself and almost nowhere on our planet is devoid of life. Narrated by David Attenborough.

results.title: Stopping the coming ice age
results.brief_description: Probably the most important video many of us will ever see. Record cold winters and record summer heat and drought, increasing floods, hurricanes and tornadoes, dying forests, massive fuel burning and the clearcutting of the tropical rainforests are all related. The next Ice Age may be virtually upon us, a natural 100,000 year cycle driven by erosion, the death and rebirth of forests and the rise and fall of greenhouse gases. It has already resulted in massive starvation. If we act quickly we may be able to stop it, if not we may be eating less in seven years.

results.title: Outward Bound - Willing and Able
results.brief_description: Part 1(a) “Willing and Able”. Outward Bound Australia conducts adventure based personal development programs combining able-bodied and physically disabled people. For those who choose an adventure, such as the one conducted on the Snowy River, there are rewards in addition to experiencing the uniqueness of the Australian wilderness. Part 1(b) “Other Courses”. An exciting overview of all Outward Bound programs. Part 2: Interview with the Executive Director.

results.title: Outward Bound - the Challenge
results.brief_description: Part 1(a) “The Challenge”. Two participants are followed through the 26 day Outward Bound Standard Course. They experience caving, expeditioning, rock climbing, rafting, canoeing, group tasks, navigation, abseiling, exploration and self discovery. Both the challenge and the personal development changes they encounter during this adventure into self-understanding are skilfully captured on film. Part 1(b) “Other Courses”. An exciting overview of all Outward Bound programs. Part 2: Interview with the Executive Director.

results.title: Big night out
results.brief_description: Wilbur Wilde and Kerry Simpson feature in this rap cartoon addressing the importance of not sharing needles and how to correctly clean them. Using animated and studio footage the story revolves around a party where the issue of safe needle use arises. “Big Night Out” provides safe use messages (ie: cleaning injecting equipment effectively and where to get new needles and syringes) via the Streetwise cartoon character, Dr Klevadik. The language utilised within the video is “street based” in order to increase target group acceptance. Aims to provide safe messages regarding intravenous drug use and potential HIV and HepB transmission.

results.title: Macedonia
results.creator_credit: Giorgos Zervoulakos and General Secretariat of Press and Information of Greece
results.brief_description: A history of Greek Macedonia from prehistoric times to the 19th Century. It covers the relationship between Macedonia and early Greece, the life of the greatest of all Macedonians, Alexander the Great, the Ottoman invasion and longterm occupation by the Turks and the 19th Century resistance to the invaders. It also retells the Greek myths and sources of contemporary folk dances in Macedonia.
